intro: Tounatea eriocarpa, commonly known as the wooly-fruited tounatea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that is covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Tounatea eriocarpa is often found in understory habitats and is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
